titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James M. Leet &c., Indictment
CWG5350

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Oldham Circuit Court } Sct
Commonwealth
vs } Indictment
Jas M Leet &c

This day came the parties by &c and Defdts demurred to the indictment which demurrer is overruled thereupon Defd'ts plead not guilty to which Plff joined issue thereupon came a jury To wit: W D. Cassady et al who being elected tried and sworn well and truly to try the issue joined, upon their oaths do say- "We of the Jury find the Defendants guilty and assess their fine at Thirty dollars each. It is therefore adjudged by the court &c
The law and facts being submitted and the court being sufficiently advised, it is adjudged that Defd't make his fine to the Comw'lth by the payment of Fifty dollars and her costs herein expended &c

A Copy
Att W G Taylor clk
